states.name: Alabama
states.description: Alabama is known as the 'Heart of Dixie' and features beautiful beaches, space exploration history at the U.S. Space & Rocket Center, and the civil rights landmarks of Birmingham.

states.name: Alaska
states.description: Alaska, the largest U.S. state by area, is known for its diverse terrain of mountains, forests, and arctic tundra, with abundant wildlife and small towns.

states.name: Arizona
states.description: Arizona is famed for the Grand Canyon, the red rocks of Sedona, Desert Botanical Garden, and the vibrant culture of cities like Phoenix and Tucson.

states.name: Arkansas
states.description: Arkansas, the 'Natural State,' offers the Ozark Mountains, Hot Springs National Park, and the Clinton Presidential Center in Little Rock.

states.name: California
states.description: California features diverse attractions from Hollywood and Disneyland to Yosemite National Park, wine country, and the iconic Golden Gate Bridge.

states.name: Colorado
states.description: Colorado is known for the Rocky Mountains, world-class skiing, Denver's cultural scenes, and outdoor adventures in all seasons.

states.name: Connecticut
states.description: Connecticut, one of the original 13 colonies, offers historic coastal towns, Yale University, and proximity to both Boston and New York City.

states.name: Delaware
states.description: Delaware, the first state to ratify the Constitution, features tax-free shopping, historic sites, and beautiful beaches along the Atlantic coast.

states.name: Florida
states.description: Florida, the 'Sunshine State,' is famous for its theme parks, beaches, the Everglades, vibrant Miami culture, and Kennedy Space Center.

states.name: Georgia
states.description: Georgia combines southern charm with urban culture, featuring Atlanta's attractions, coastal Savannah, and the beautiful North Georgia mountains.

states.name: Hawaii
states.description: Hawaii is a tropical paradise with volcanic landscapes, world-famous beaches, Polynesian culture, and the historic Pearl Harbor site.

states.name: Idaho
states.description: Idaho offers spectacular wilderness areas, the resort town of Sun Valley, white-water rafting, and Craters of the Moon National Monument.

states.name: Illinois
states.description: Illinois is home to Chicago's iconic skyline, rich prairie lands, the Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library, and Route 66 attractions.

states.name: Indiana
states.description: Indiana features the Indianapolis Motor Speedway, beautiful state parks, Amish country, and charming small towns across the Hoosier state.

states.name: Iowa
states.description: Iowa combines agricultural heritage with cultural attractions like the Field of Dreams movie site, Amana Colonies, and the Iowa State Fair.

states.name: Kansas
states.description: Kansas, the 'Sunflower State,' offers plains dotted with historic sites, the Cosmosphere space museum, and Tallgrass Prairie National Preserve.

states.name: Kentucky
states.description: Kentucky is known for horse racing, bourbon distilleries, Mammoth Cave National Park, and the Appalachian region's natural beauty.

states.name: Louisiana
states.description: Louisiana's unique cultural blend is reflected in New Orleans' French Quarter, bayou country, Creole cuisine, and vibrant music scenes.

states.name: Maine
states.description: Maine features rugged coastlines, Acadia National Park, historic lighthouses, and charming coastal towns with renowned seafood.

states.name: Maryland
states.description: Maryland offers Chesapeake Bay adventures, historic Annapolis, Baltimore's Inner Harbor, and proximity to Washington, D.C.

states.name: Massachusetts
states.description: Massachusetts combines Revolutionary War history in Boston with the academic prestige of Harvard and MIT, Cape Cod beaches, and Berkshire Mountains.

states.name: Michigan
states.description: Michigan is defined by the Great Lakes, automotive history in Detroit, Mackinac Island, and the natural beauty of the Upper Peninsula.

states.name: Minnesota
states.description: Minnesota, 'Land of 10,000 Lakes,' offers wilderness areas, the Mall of America, vibrant Twin Cities culture, and the headwaters of the Mississippi River.

states.name: Mississippi
states.description: Mississippi's heritage includes blues music trails, antebellum homes, Gulf Coast beaches, and Civil Rights historical sites.

states.name: Missouri
states.description: Missouri features the Gateway Arch in St. Louis, Branson entertainment, Ozark Mountains, and Kansas City's jazz heritage and barbecue.

states.name: Montana
states.description: Montana, 'Big Sky Country,' is home to portions of Yellowstone and Glacier National Parks, vast wilderness areas, and authentic western heritage.

states.name: Nebraska
states.description: Nebraska combines agricultural traditions with attractions like the Henry Doorly Zoo, Chimney Rock, and the unique Sandhill Crane migration.

states.name: Nevada
states.description: Nevada is known for Las Vegas entertainment, Reno gaming, Lake Tahoe recreation, and vast desert landscapes with ghost towns.

states.name: New Hampshire
states.description: New Hampshire offers White Mountain hiking, picturesque covered bridges, tax-free shopping, and beautiful fall foliage.

states.name: New Jersey
states.description: New Jersey features Atlantic City entertainment, Jersey Shore beaches, Princeton University, and easy access to New York City and Philadelphia.

states.name: New Mexico
states.description: New Mexico, the 'Land of Enchantment,' blends Native American, Hispanic, and Anglo cultures with attractions like Santa Fe's art scene and Carlsbad Caverns.

states.name: New York
states.description: New York offers world-famous New York City alongside the natural beauty of the Adirondacks, Niagara Falls, and the Finger Lakes wine region.

states.name: North Carolina
states.description: North Carolina combines beaches, the Great Smoky Mountains, Research Triangle innovation, and Charlotte's urban appeal.

states.name: North Dakota
states.description: North Dakota features Theodore Roosevelt National Park, Native American heritage sites, and the unique International Peace Garden.

states.name: Ohio
states.description: Ohio combines urban attractions in Cleveland, Cincinnati, and Columbus with Amish country, Lake Erie shores, and the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame.

states.name: Oklahoma
states.description: Oklahoma blends Native American culture, western heritage, Route 66 attractions, and the unique landscape of the Wichita Mountains.

states.name: Oregon
states.description: Oregon offers spectacular Pacific coastline, the Columbia River Gorge, Portland's vibrant culture, and Crater Lake National Park.

states.name: Pennsylvania
states.description: Pennsylvania combines Philadelphia's historic sites, Pittsburgh's renewal, Amish country, and Gettysburg's Civil War significance.

states.name: Rhode Island
states.description: Rhode Island, the smallest state, offers Newport mansions, Providence culture, historic sailing traditions, and beautiful coastal scenery.

states.name: South Carolina
states.description: South Carolina features Charleston's historic charm, Myrtle Beach, Hilton Head Island resorts, and rich Southern heritage.

states.name: South Dakota
states.description: South Dakota is home to Mount Rushmore, Badlands National Park, historic Deadwood, and the annual Sturgis Motorcycle Rally.

states.name: Tennessee
states.description: Tennessee offers Nashville's country music scene, Memphis blues, Great Smoky Mountains National Park, and Graceland.

states.name: Texas
states.description: Texas, the 'Lone Star State,' combines big city life in Houston and Dallas with the historic Alamo, Gulf Coast beaches, and Hill Country scenery.

states.name: Utah
states.description: Utah features the 'Mighty Five' national parks, world-class skiing around Salt Lake City, and Mormon heritage sites.

states.name: Vermont
states.description: Vermont offers picturesque New England villages, Green Mountain forests, ski resorts, maple syrup traditions, and fall foliage tours.

states.name: Virginia
states.description: Virginia combines historical sites like Colonial Williamsburg and Monticello with Shenandoah National Park and Virginia Beach.

states.name: Washington
states.description: Washington state features Seattle's iconic Space Needle, Mount Rainier, Olympic National Park, and the unique San Juan Islands.

states.name: West Virginia
states.description: West Virginia, the 'Mountain State,' offers whitewater rafting, the New River Gorge Bridge, Appalachian culture, and scenic mountain drives.

states.name: Wisconsin
states.description: Wisconsin combines Milwaukee's brewery heritage, Madison's college town vibe, Door County's charm, and the unique Wisconsin Dells.

states.name: Wyoming
states.description: Wyoming's natural wonders include Yellowstone and Grand Teton National Parks, Devils Tower, and the authentic western experience of Jackson Hole.
